description: Students apply computational techniques and tools to the analysis of biological data. From mining large genetic sequence databases to simulating population dynamics, computer programming is rapidly becoming essential to the study of a broad range of biological systems. This course introduces computer programming to biologists and allows for the creative application of this skill to an array of biological questions, with an emphasis on advanced genetics topics. Prerequisites: Biology 126 and 233. Offered alternate years.
name: Prin of Bioinformatics
notes: Students in Bio 315 must also register for lab Bio 315 L
prerequisites: Prerequisites: Biology 126 and 233. Offered alternate years.
title: Principles of Bioinformatics
